creator: mozilla98

content: This usually means something is interferring with Thunderbird's update of settings at shutdown. This might be an antivirus product or other firewall issue. This can often be verified by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder.' the settings file is named prefs.js. If you see more than one, such as prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js, that is an indication of the problem. This occasionally happens when prefs.js is marked read-only. I do not know the solution for your particular situation. Let me know results of your review.
creator: davidsk

content: So I checked that directory. There are prefs-1.js through prefs-18.js. So your suspicion was correct. Now to figure out the solution.
creator: lsedels

content:
To fix the immediate issue, try this: - exit thunderbird - delete all of those except the highest-numbered one. - rename that one to prefs.js - that will contain your last attempted update. - if the attempt to delete the original prefs.js says it doesn't exist, you may need to unhide it.

This doesn't solve the issue, but may at least restore your intended setting. my first suspicion would be theantivirus. see you can tell it to avoid the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder.
creator: davidsk

content: You're right. When I tried to rename the most recent one, it wouldn't let me saying there's an existing file of that name. However I can't seem to unhide it. I tried properties on the directory but it's already set to show hidden files.
creator: lsedels

content: Found another prefs.js in another profile. Copied it OVER the hidden one and then deleted it. Then renamed the most recent prefs-18.js to prefs.js and it seems to be preserving my changes now.
creator: lsedels

content: Whew! Thanks for sharing that. I hope the original issue is resolved soon for you.

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Buonasera e grazie del supporto!

Provo a rispondere a tutte le domande: 1. Versione di Thunderbird: l'ultima, avendolo scaricato ieri 2. Versione del sistema operativo: Windows 11 3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.): due fastwebnet, due gmail, una hotmail, una pec 4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP): tutte IMAP 5. Estensioni installate: nessuna 6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird: "Messaggio non inviato" 7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili): Windows Defender 8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto): non credo sia utile
creator: f.bravin

content:
here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and not running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it. This is to replace all content of the thunderbird folder. 
#   start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: This usually means something is interfering with Thunderbird's update of settings at shutdown. This might be an antivirus product or other firewall issue. This can often be verified by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder.' the settings file is named prefs.js. If you see more than one, such as prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js, that is an indication of the problem. This occasionally happens when prefs.js is marked read-only. I do not know the solution for your particular situation. This may not be your problem, but it does show the same symptoms.
